intro: Cyphostemma hispidiflorum, commonly known as the hairy-flowered cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and persistent, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruit is a follicle containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
